column4: is there a method to debug what debconf-frontend is doing? everytime i install a new package, the postinst fails because there is an error 1.
for example: http://pastebin.com/m657d38f2
you get the post-inst script to be verbose -- usually you edit the post-inst script and add "set +x" (i think)
that looks like the postfix preinst script failing -- is that the script you modified?
every preinst script fails ?
can you post a more elaborate output -- that maybe contains many of these errors?

i'm not sure, i've never tried -- but i think it's crucial to try and debug the script and get to the source of the problem -- if i understand this german right -- does the error say there was an error unpacking the .deb file?
- this is the same error right - http://translate.google.com/translate_t?langpair=de|en
ohh crap --sorry
this one - http://pastebin.com/m657d38f2
you weren't prompted for anything at all?
nope
very strange -- have you tried adding "set -x" to  /var/lib/dpkg/info/tzdata.postinst ?
sure
but at the point frontend starts with $1 on that script, i see nothing
if you are making reference to "set -x" -- it can be added anywhere in the script -- preferably at line #2 just after the shebang
nothing usefull
you could try the guys in #debian -- they helped me through something similar once -- i'm lost with this one
http://pastebin.com/m6aca4351
i think it's more painless to reinstall then to hang around with debian-guys.
actually you could try this -- sudo dpkg-reconfigure -plow debconf   (and select the ncurses interface)
root@kaya:~# sudo dpkg-reconfigure -plow debconf
sheesh, sounds like a debconf problem -- try reinstalling it -- I have a feeling it might solve the problem, it certainly looks to be it now -- sudo apt-get install --reinstall debconf
